oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eads Rosenwald School: right-angled view from the road
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of one section of a one-story brick school complex. This red brick building with a green cross gable hipped roof is one of the subsequent additions to the complex. Four entrances are visible; three of which are part of protruding extensions. They have a flat porch roof with stairs leading up to a pair of white doors. The fourth entrance is a characterized by a white door and a set of stairs. Four of the visible windows are placed on the center structure. They are two sets of ten light single tilt slide windows. On each extension, there two ten light casement windows.

The Eads School was built with support of the Julius Rosenwald fund. Further additions were made later, most of which were completed in 1953. The elementary school was used as a clinic for a short period of time, but it was later completely abandoned. In 2015, the building was scheduled for demolition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee
